snippet: The Egyptian police appeared on Monday to have postponed once again their threat to begin choking off two Cairo sit-ins where tens of thousands have gathered to protest the ouster of President Mohamed Morsi.
abstract: Egyptian police appear to have postponed once again their threat to begin choking off two Cairo sit-ins where tens of thousands have gathered to protest the ouster of Pres Mohamed Morsi.

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim and Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Egyptian police appeared on Monday to have postponed once again their threat to begin choking off two Cairo sit-ins where tens of thousands have gathered to protest the ouster of President Mohamed Morsi.

headline.main: Police Put Off Dispersal of Pro-Morsi Sit-Ins
headline.print_headline: Police Put Off Dispersal of Pro-Morsi Sit-Ins
